title: Regulatory Bodies Investigate AI Epistemic Rigidity Concerns
summary:
The U.S. National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) launches a comprehensive investigation into epistemic rigidity in AI systems following mounting evidence of systemic biases and safety backfire effects.

Key focus areas:
1. Developing new testing protocols for AI model bias
2. Creating adaptive evaluation frameworks
3. Proposing regulatory guidelines to address epistemic limitations

The investigation represents a significant escalation in governmental oversight of AI development, signaling growing concerns about the potential societal impacts of rigid AI decision-making systems.
actors: White House Office of Science and Technology Policy

sources.title: NIST AI Safety and Bias Investigation Announcement
